H0.text: Soil is what plants use sunlight to make.

H1.text: Minerals are what plants use sunlight to make.

H2.text: Food is what plants make using sunlight.

H3.text: Water is made by plants using sunlight.

A4.text: Photosynthetic organisms store the converted chemical energy within the bonds of intracellular organic compounds (complex compounds containing carbon), typically carbohydrates like sugars (mainly glucose, fructose and sucrose), starches, phytoglycogen and cellulose.

A5.text: The basic reaction by which organisms use photosynthesis to produce food (such as glucose) was outlined.
